item.title: Fores - 1983 - Science and the ‘Neolithic Paradox’
item.description: Fores, M. (1983). Science and the ‘Neolithic Paradox.’ History of Science, 21(2), 141–163. https://doi.org/10.1177/007327538302100202 Michael Fores wrote in such a way that his texts would only be cheaped by added commentary:

item.title: Lynch on Schutz: the world of thought and life and death
item.description: In [[Lynch1993]] Schutz’s definition of the “world of both the natural and the social scientist” as a “world of thought” that differs radically from “the world within which we act and within which we are born and die.
